channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Birational Equivalences and Generalized Weyl Algebras
item.description: arXiv:2009.14801v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We calculate suitably localized Hochschild homologies of various quantum groups and Podle\'s spheres after realizing them as generalized Weyl algebras (GWAs). We use the fact that every GWA is birationally equivalent to a smash product with a 1-torus. We also address and solve the birational equivalence problem, and the birational smoothness problem for GWAs.
item.dc:creator: Atabey Kaygun

item.title: A partitioned manifold index theorem for noncompact hypersurfaces
item.description: arXiv:2507.16591v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Roe's partitioned manifold index theorem applies when a complete Riemannian manifold $M$ is cut into two pieces along a compact hypersurface $N$. It states that a version of the index of a Dirac operator on $M$ localized to $N$ equals the index of the corresponding Dirac operator on $N$. This yields obstructions to positive scalar curvature, and implies cobordism invariance of the index of Dirac operators on compact manifolds. We generalize this result to cases where $N$ may be noncompact, under assumptions on the way it is embedded into $M$. This results in an equality between two classes in the $K$-theory of the Roe algebra of $N$. Bunke and Ludewig, and Engel and Wulff, have recently obtained related results based on different approaches.
item.dc:creator: Peter Hochs, Thijs de Kok
